title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki on 10 February 2015 - XWiki
content:
<Chuguniy> has joined #xwiki  
01:42 <vrachieru> has quit

06:04 <Denis> has quit

08:45 <vmassol> has quit  
08:51 <vmassol> has joined #xwiki  
09:01 <gdelhumeau> has joined #xwiki  
09:15 <woshilapin> has joined #xwiki  
09:23 <gsmeria> has joined #xwiki  
09:38 <mflorea> has joined #xwiki  
09:39 <mflorea> has quit  
09:39 <mflorea1> has joined #xwiki  
09:44 <cjd> has joined #xwiki  
10:00 <tmortagne> has joined #xwiki  
10:03 <evalica> has joined #xwiki  
10:05 <Enygma`> has joined #xwiki  
10:37 <vmassol> mflorea1: how come so many APIs are broken: "We've refactored the client code of the WYSIWYG editor to use the new tree."  
10:37 <vmassol> http://www.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/ReleaseNotes/ReleaseNotesXWiki70M1#HAPIBreakages  
10:37 <vmassol> should they be APIs?  
10:37 <vmassol> maybe they should have been in some internal package?  
10:38 <vmassol> (I'm curious)  
10:39 <mflorea1> they are not real API, considering that the java code is compiled to javascript, but you can write a new GWT module that reuses some of the WYSIWYG java code. They could be moved to internal packages but that would also mean breaking the API  
10:39 <vmassol> it's been broken anyway so if we want that it's the right time ;)  
10:40 <mflorea1> I don't want to spend time on it :)  
10:40 <vmassol> (I don't know if we want it though, I don't know enough)  
10:40 <vmassol> well right now you've broken a large number of apis, it's not really nice either...  
10:40 <vmassol> and doesn't look good int he RN  
10:40 <vmassol> :)  
10:41 <vmassol> we're priding ourselves that we don't break backward compat so we need to try it to the max ;)  
10:41 <vmassol> anyway....  
10:41 <cjd> 10:40 <@vmassol> and doesn't look good int he RN  <-- int he;   I do that too  
10:41 <vmassol> hehe  
10:43 <mflorea1> large in number, but if you look at the list you'll see that what it contains is:  
10:43 <mflorea1> \* refactoring of the XWikiExplorer to use the new tree  
10:43 <mflorea1> \* small changes in the 2 steps that were using the tree (and their base class)  
10:45 <vmassol> maybe it's not important now because we have nobody extending the WYSIWYG? Still it would be nice to think about how to improve that in the future (either by moving them to internal or something else)  
10:46 <tmortagne> future is probably without this WYSIWYG ;)  
10:46 <vmassol> :)  
10:46 <vmassol> good point tmortagne  
10:47 <vmassol> mflorea1 should be able to tell us aobut that real soon now :)  
10:47 <vmassol> (hopefully)  
10:48 <mflorea1> I'm on it. I hope to publish today or tomorrow a small extension and an investigation doc on CKEditor  
10:48 <vmassol> cool  
10:53 <vmassol> evalica: hi, when do you plan to release 6.4.1?  
11:16 <evalica> vmassol: still waiting for a PR from Victor  
11:16 <vmassol> so today?  
11:18 <evalica> yes  
11:20 <Enygma`> tmortagne: any idea why this occasionally happens? http://ci.xwiki.org/job/xwiki-enterprise/564/console  
11:20 <Enygma`> Caused by: java.lang.NullPointerException at org.xwiki.extension.repository.internal.core.DefaultCoreExtensionRepository.exists(DefaultCoreExtensionRepository.java:181)  
11:21 <Enygma`> just remember seeing it a couple of times recently on jenkins builds  
11:21 <ClemensR> has joined #xwiki  
11:22 <tmortagne> Enygma`: no idea no, seems to be a bug in reflections but not sure what triggers it  
11:26 <gsmeria> has quit  
11:27 <xwikiorg\_guest\_8> has joined #xwiki  
11:31 <xwikiorg\_guest\_8> Hi, I have some problems with my xwiki 6.4 installation. I use it with Postgresql. I can't see installed extensions und neither the standart Navigation Pannel is viewing something. but i've added sites and extensions. i hope someone can help me and sorry for my bad english  
11:46 <gsmeria> has joined #xwiki  
12:12 <cjd> quick q: where is the data stored which tells whether a subwiki is "local user" or "global user" subwiki ?  
12:15 <Slashman> has joined #xwiki  
13:49 <ClemensR> has left #xwiki  
14:05 <gdelhumeau> has quit  
14:06 <Bugendolf> has quit  
14:16 <Bugendolf> has joined #xwiki  
14:24 <gdelhumeau> has joined #xwiki  
14:29 <evalica> Ann: I'll start soon the build release step for 6.4.1  
14:32 <gdelhumeau> has quit  
14:58 <gdelhumeau> has joined #xwiki  
14:59 <vmassol> evalica: I'm ready to commit my code...  
14:59 <vmassol> in platform  
14:59 <cjd> oh hi vm  
14:59 <vmassol> on the 6.4.x branch  
14:59 <vmassol> what should I do?  
14:59 <cjd> I have a small question  
15:00 <vmassol> cjd: yes?  
15:00 <cjd>  where is the data stored which tells whether a subwiki is "local user" or "global user" subwiki ?  
15:00 <cjd> I have been trying to find the answer for a half hour, documentation and code seem equally opaque  
15:00 <evalica> vmassol: I'm still releasing 6.4.1  
15:01 <cjd> Not judging (my project is same) just trying to justify my RTFM question  
15:01 <vmassol> hmm I don't know. it's not in the wiki descriptor? gdelhumeau should be able to both give you the answer and improve the doc ;)  
15:01 <cjd> heh  
15:01 <vmassol> (since he worked on that)  
15:01 <Enygma`> I know it`s stored in the subwiki, not in the descriptor  
15:01 <gdelhumeau> you need to have the value or the actual xobject holding it?  
15:02 <vmassol> evalica: ok committing on master and waiting for your goahead to merge on 6.4.x  
15:02 <cjd> gdelhumeau: I need the name of the page which contains it, superwiki or subwiki  
15:02 <evalica> vmassol: k - thanks - I'll announce when you can commit on 6.4.x branch  
15:03 <cjd> gdelhumeau: then I'll be able to hunt down the object and go from there  
15:04 <gdelhumeau> cjd: subwiki:WikiManager.WikiUserConfiguration  
15:05 <cjd> ok and changing that will change the result of  $services.wiki.user.getUserScope()   ??  
15:05 <vmassol> ah too bad it's named Configuration  
15:05 <vmassol> all our config pages are named \*Config so far  
15:06 <vmassol> cjd (and all): http://www.occupygpl.org/ ;)  
15:06 <cjd> Just standardize around not having any naming conventions, it's\_one\_standard EverybodyCanAdopt withmaximumease  
15:06 <gdelhumeau> cjd: yes it's not cached if I remember correctly  
15:06 <cjd> vmassol: lol brought to you by apple, plz giv moar freelabor :D  
15:07 <vmassol> don't forget that I'm an apache software foundation member! I like that! :)  
15:08 <cjd> remember though that before GPL, it was unthinkable to have open source which wasn't cannabalized as soon as it showed some value  
15:10 <msmeria> has quit  
15:10 <vmassol> cjd: I'm too young, I don't remember that time. I only started open source in 2000  
15:10 <vmassol> and I started with the ASF  
15:11 <vmassol> actually it was 1999  
15:11 <cjd> well I wasn't there either but the story is RMS actually started thinking about the viral license because a company took a lisp interpreter he wrote, started maintaining it and locked down the source w/o giving him access  
15:12 <cjd> basically they took his own code, started marketing it as a proprietary competitor to his project and would not give him back the improvements  
15:19 <xwikibot> has joined #xwiki  
15:27 <xwikiorg\_guest\_8> has quit  
15:35 <sburjan> has quit  
15:45 <ClemensR> has joined #xwiki  
15:50 <evalica> we can now commit in stable-6.4.x  
16:16 <vmassol> Pbas: the new images are too large :)  
16:16 <vmassol> ans you should use the {{image}} macro  
16:17 <Pbas> Yes I know I work on it :-)  
16:19 <Pbas> I use XWiki Syntax 2.0 [[image:img.png||width="25" height="25"]], is it OK?  
16:19 <vmassol> no  
16:19 <vmassol> "you should use the {{image}} macro"  
16:20 <vmassol> see the doc guide  
16:20 <Pbas> K I will search about it  
16:20 <vmassol> http://dev.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Community/DocGuide  
16:20 <vmassol> check the section for images: http://dev.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Community/DocGuide#HScreenshots2FImages  
16:20 <vmassol> IMo you should resize your images before you upload them  
16:21 <vmassol> they're way too marge  
16:21 <vmassol> \*large  
16:21 <vmassol> it costs unnecessary bandwidth  
16:21 <vmassol> and CPU  
16:21 <Pbas> I though it was better for user: they can see large image by a click...  
16:22 <Pbas> K I will resize the source  
16:22 <vmassol> you mean for people with disabiities?  
16:22 <vmassol> because here it's very large  
16:22 <vmassol> check the doc guide  
16:22 <vmassol> you'll have recommended sizes  
16:23 <vmassol> my guess is that you're on a mac, right?  
16:23 <vmassol> (with retina display)  
16:23 <Pbas> K I will ... do it if you let me 5 mn :-)  
16:23 <Pbas> No I'm on Debian  
16:23 <vmassol> ah ok  
16:23 <Pbas> Mac is too expensive  
16:23 <vmassol> because on the mac I get this too  
16:23 <vmassol> since it has retina display  
16:23 <vmassol> so I always have to reduce the size of all my screenshots  
16:23 <vmassol> divide by 2  
16:24 <vmassol> the problem with browser resize is that you'll get some not sharp images and only those who click will get the sharp ones  
16:25 <vmassol> (in addition to the bandwidth)  
16:27 <vmassol> guys, do we have a common term to represent either a Group or a User?  
16:27 <vmassol> Denis1: ?  
16:27 <vmassol> Denis1: you mentioned that you consider them the same in the rights api  
16:28 <vmassol> in the UserIterator I've jsut written I've used variables named userOrGroupReference  but I don't like it  
16:28 <Pbas> Is it OK now? Or do you prefer remove image? http://platform.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/DevGuide/APIGuide#HAccessobjectsfromanypageandloopoverallobjectsofsameClass  
16:28 <vmassol> I'd prefer a compon word  
16:28 <vmassol> \*common  
16:28 <Denis1> is now known as <Denis>  
16:28 <vmassol> Pbas: the code snippets are still not correct  
16:29 <Denis> What I do in the security API is considering a group to be a user  
16:29 <vmassol> Denis: not very explicit  
16:29 <vmassol> can be confusing IMO  
16:29 <Denis> so I deal with user most of the time, and I care about the fact these could be group sometimes  
16:29 <vmassol> you need some javado to explain that what you call userReference can be a group or a user  
16:30 <Denis> groupref extends userref IIWR  
16:30 <vmassol> they're both DocumentReference  
16:30 <Denis> IIRC !  
16:31 <Denis> in the security API user are no more DocRef  
16:31 <vmassol> the problem is that the XWiki UI differentiates them so we're used to the 2  notions of Groups and Users  
16:31 <vmassol> so if you say DocumentReference userReference  
16:31 <vmassol> you're not going to know if it can accept a group or not  
16:32 <vmassol> and the user of this api will not know  
16:32 <vmassol> unless you document it in the javadoc  
16:32 <Denis> sure, this is bad not to have a higher level ref for users  
16:33 <Denis> but this could be large refactoring to change that  
16:33 <vmassol> and I can't find a good English word to represent both  
16:34 <Denis> actually, even the security API does not really check the docref is a user ref before converting it to a userref internally  
16:34 <vmassol> so I'm using userOrGroupReference but I don't like it  
16:34 <Denis> we used to do that  
16:35 <vmassol> TBH I 'm still not convinced that Groups extend USers  
16:35 <gdelhumeau> MemberEntity?  
16:35 <vmassol> but I'm going with it FTM  
16:35 <vmassol> member is not bad  
16:35 <vmassol> at least it shows it's not a group nor a user  
16:36 <vmassol> is it better than userOrGroupReference?  
16:36 <vmassol> probably less explicit unfortunately  
16:37 <tmortagne> vmassol: member imply it's part of some group you are manipulating  
16:37 <momomomomo> has joined #xwiki  
16:38 <vmassol> actually it should be DocumentReference groupOrUserReference and List<DocumentReference> groupAndUserReferences  
16:38 <vmassol> (fixing my code)  
16:39 <gdelhumeau> or you considere a user is a group of 1 people and you say "group" :)  
16:39 <tmortagne> identity  
16:39 <vmassol> identityReference  
16:40 <gdelhumeau> not bad  
16:40 <Bugen\_do> has joined #xwiki  
16:40 <tmortagne> should be ok until cjd looks at it :)  
16:40 <vmassol> what's your identity? I'm a group!  
16:42 <gsmeria> has quit  
16:43 <vmassol> yes identity is the best so far IMO  
16:53 <vmassol> Pbas: yu should also use ##…## for literals  
16:53 <vmassol> fixing  
16:53 <Pbas> K thxs. You can remove screenshot too if it is too much.  
16:55 <vmassol> they're really small now ;) but ok I won't bother you any more… need to go back to my code anyway, thanks for your help in improving the doc!  
16:55 <vmassol> there's something we're not very clear about  
16:55 <vmassol> it's where snippets should be added: we have a lot on e.x.o and some in the reference doc  
16:55 <Pbas> Need a notice to use javadoc IMO :-)  
16:56 <vmassol> in the future we need to create a snippet.xwiki.org wiki  
16:56 <vmassol> with only snippets  
16:56 <vmassol> and potentially link to them from the reference doc  
16:56 <Pbas> update xwiki syntax then?  
16:56 <vmassol> that will make it better to locate all code snippets and search in them, etc  
16:56 <vmassol> "update xwiki syntax then?" sorry I don't understand  
16:57 <Pbas> "xwiki syntax page" :  
16:57 <Pbas> Use snippet image  
16:57 <tmortagne> vmassol: I tough moving snippets to a dedicated wiki was more or less decided and just needed to be done  
16:57 <vmassol> it is decided IMO  
16:58 <vmassol> (even though we may not have discussed it with everyone but not sure it's needed)  
16:58 <vmassol> but it needs to be done now :)  
16:58 <Pbas> xwiki syntax doc indicated imge link with [[image ]] and not snippet [[image}}  
16:58 <vmassol> {{image}} is a macro  
16:59 <tmortagne> Pbas: {{image}} is a special xwiki.org documentation dedicated macro that only exist on xwiki.org  
16:59 <vmassol> Pbas: yu're mixing things  
16:59 <vmassol> you're mixing the xwiki syntax  
16:59 <vmassol> with how we want images to be displayed on xwiki.org  
16:59 <Pbas> ha Ok I understand  
16:59 <tmortagne> it's just here to standardize how to display them in that wiki  
16:59 <Pbas> Of course  
17:02 <evalica> has quit  
17:03 <Enygma`> has quit  
17:12 <momomomomo> has quit  
17:16 <ClemensR> has left #xwiki  
17:31 <momomomomo> has joined #xwiki  
18:02 <Chuguniy> has joined #xwiki  
18:03 <momomomomo> has quit  
18:05 <cjd> has quit  
18:07 <woshilapin> has quit  
18:12 <mflorea1> vmassol: do you have a minute?  
18:13 <mflorea1> it seems that the clirr-maven-plugin causes the entire build life cycle to be executed again, even if I set xwiki.clirr.skip=true  
18:14 <tmortagne> has quit  
18:14 <vmassol> mflorea1: ok. I haven't investigated. Let me check quickly their mojo  
18:15 <vmassol> yes skip will have no effect on that  
18:15 <vmassol> (used too late)  
18:16 <vmassol> code is there: http://svn.codehaus.org/mojo/tags/clirr-maven-plugin-2.6.1/src/main/java/org/codehaus/mojo/clirr/ClirrCheckMojo.java  
18:16 <mflorea1> this is not a problem most of the time because most of the plugins are smart enough to not do the work twice (e.g. the compile plugins checks that the sources haven't changed). But in my case I run an external sh file (the CKEditor builder)  
18:17 <vmassol> http://maven.apache.org/developers/mojo-api-specification.html  
18:17 <vmassol> check @execute  
18:17 <vmassol> since @execute phase="compile"  
18:17 <vmassol> it means it'll execute a // lifecycle of compile  
18:17 <mflorea1> hmm, then I could put my thing after compile phase  
18:18 <vmassol> yep postcompile or later  
18:20 <vmassol> lifecycles are avail here: http://maven.apache.org/guides/introduction/introduction-to-the-lifecycle.html (the "Default Lifecycle" section))  
18:20 <mflorea1> yep, trying with process-classes  
18:21 <KermitTheFragger> has quit  
18:23 <mflorea1> vmassol: works, thanks for the hint!  
18:23 <vmassol> cool
